title: Which Native American tribe lived on the island Christopher Columbus had landed? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The “Arawak” people lived on the Caribbean island Columbus first landed on. Ever heard of them? No, I didn’t think so. The reason you haven’t is because, surprise surprise, they all died. This was often the case with the new world; the pioneers would trample over anything and everything that got in their way. Here’s why…  the Arawak natives were a friendly people; but you don’t hear about them because they didn’t survive the white man. When the Spanish came to the Caribbean on Mr. Columbus’ second voyage, Christopher, being the smart guy that he was, brought some sugar canes from the Middle East. They didn’t grow very well in Arabia, but he hoped that the warm, wet climate would mean they could be mass-grown and harvested, in a sort of plantation- and he was right! The sugar grew extraoardinaly well! But there was a problem.  Growing the sugar was tiring work! They knew that it would be profitable, but Chris (I’m not going to write his full name it’s too long.) was a sailor, not a farmer, and the work was truly backbreaking- and there was the problem of the arawaks. They were friendly enough, but how would they take to their island being cleared to make way for sugar? So he decided to kill 2 birds with one stone. He could force the arawaks! The savages would be just fine, yes. They were going to make a killing! But 50 years down the line, and the arawaks were dead or dying; their culture with it. For that, you can thank Chris.They weren’t immune to many of the diseases brought from Europe, such as cholera and disentry, and these gentle Hunter-Gatherer people weren’t suited to the high intensity labour of sugar farming. The colony found other solutions to this, and eventually wound up with shipping enslaved peoples across the Atlantic from Africa in what became known as the slave trade.  Anyway, I hope you enjoyed reading this. Goodbye. For Source, email me; dooron101@gmail.com

The Lucayan People were the first tribe that Colombus met in the Bahamas. The Tainos were the second tribe he met they were spread in almost all the islands. The third group was The Ciguayos in the Dominican Republic Fourth The Macuriges in Cuba Fifth: The Caribs or Kalinagos, Cannibals that controlled all the islands. Sixth: The Siboney, part of the Taino Family. Seventh: The Guanahatabey in the second voyage of Colombus. Eighth: Third Voyage, The Arawaks in the Hispaniola. Ninth: The Chontales in Central America in his last voyage the fourth.

The people who lived on the islands that Christopher Columbus explored on his original sojourn to the New World were called the Caribe tribe. For whom the Caribbean Sea is named after. Although each individual island may have had a band that went by their own name. As others have stated, the Taino were the band on the first island Columbus encountered.
I think the first group he encountered was the Taíno and the second the Island Caribs
